business.headline: Silver jumps Rs 5000 to hit record high of Rs 2.56 lakh per kg in Delhi marketsSilver prices jumped by Rs 5,000 to a fresh all-time high of Rs 2.56 lakh per kilogram in the Delhi market, driven by strong safe-haven demand, robust industrial buying and supply concerns.

Budget 2026: Why insurance and policy reforms are in focusAs Budget 2026 approaches, the insurance industry is pushing for structural tax reforms, enhanced retirement security, and measures to improve access to inclusive insurance products, focusing on how policy direction will impact premium financing and sector growth.

Netflix offering better value: Warner Bros rejects Paramount's revised hostile bidParamount launched a hostile takeover bid worth USD 108.4 billion for Warner Bros. Discovery on December 8, disrupting Warner Bros' preliminary merger talks with Netflix.

Budget 2026: Last year's income tax changes and what may be in focus this timeBudget 2025 delivered meaningful relief to a large section of salaried taxpayers, sharply narrowed the gap between the old and new tax regimes, and set the direction for how personal taxation would evolve going forward.

India's GDP growth expected at 7.4% in FY26Government measures played an important role in supporting growth. Income tax relief and steps to rationalise GST rates helped shore up consumer demand, even as global conditions remained uncertain.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as auto, energy stocks drag despite IT gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 102.20 points to close at 84,961.14, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 37.95 points to end at 26,140.75.

Airfare spike under scanner as government seeks data from major airlines: ReportIndia's Directorate General of Civil Aviation, which oversees safety, has written to airlines asking for average fares on each route they operated on, for economy and premium economy seats, over the period December 1-15, according to a report.

Employer not paying salary or incentives? Here's what you can doCases of delayed salaries, unpaid incentives and withheld bonuses have become more frequent, especially in young companies and firms facing cash stress. Legal experts say salary and incentives are not favours.

How Sebi's 15% rule sets a ceiling on broker growth, explains Zerodha's Nithin KamathNithin Kamath said Sebi has fixed a 15% open interest limit for brokers in the derivatives market. This means no single broker is allowed to hold more than 15% of the total market open interest at any given time.

The hidden cost quietly eating up to 25% of your mutual fund returnsA study by 1 Finance Research shows that over a 10-year holding period, more than 80% of equity mutual fund schemes leave investors in regular plans at least 25% worse off than those invested in the direct plan of the same scheme.

Silver prices drop over Rs 5,000, gold slips more than Rs 1,100. Check latest ratesAfter a strong rally in recent sessions, gold and silver prices turned lower on Wednesday. Silver saw a fall of more than Rs 5,000, while gold also became cheaper by more than Rs 1,100.

Inside India's insurance mis-selling problem and why it remains hard to fixInsurance mis-selling remains widespread even under regulatory watch. How does it keep slipping past rules, checks, and repeated warnings? Read on to find out.

Amazon Pay launches fixed deposit service with returns of up to 8%. Check detailsAmazon Pay users can now do more than just pay bills and shop online. The company has launched a fixed deposit service that lets customers invest in FDs through the app, with returns going up to 8%.

Explained: Why Venezuela's stock market jumped 50% in a day after the US attackThe benchmark Venezuela IBC Index, which tracks shares traded in Caracas (capital of Venezuela), surged 50% in a single session on Tuesday.

Titan share price up 4%: Why is the Jhunjhunwala stock rising today?The stock opened higher at Rs 4,200.45 compared with the previous close of Rs 4,111.10. During the session, it touched an intraday high of Rs 4282.00 and a low of Rs 4,200.45. The volume-weighted average price stood at Rs 4,254.78.
Sensex opens 184 points lower, Nifty below 26,150; Titan up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 255.21 points to 84,808.13, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 72.90 points to 26,105.80 as of 9:47 am.

Gold and silver rates today: Buy, wait or sell?Gold prices in India were largely steady on January 7, 2026, with only a marginal rise seen across purity levels. As per the latest data, 24K gold was priced at Rs 13,883 per gram, up by Rs 1.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO to open soon: Latest GMP update for investorsThe price band for the IPO of Bharat Coking Coal has been fixed at Rs 21 to Rs 23 per share. The lot size is 600 shares. Based on the upper price band, a retail investor will need to invest at least Rs 13,800 for one lot.

Reliance sees worst session since June 2024. What should investors do now?Reliance Industries shares closed 4.5% lower at Rs 1,507.6, marking their steepest decline since June 4, 2024. During the session, the stock slipped as much as 5.1% to Rs 1,496.30, hitting its lowest level since November 11, as selling pressure intensified.
Sensex ends 376 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; RIL tanks 4%The S&P BSE Sensex declined 376.28 points to close at 85,063.34, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 71.60 points to end at 26,178.70.

entertainment.headline: Vijay's Jana Nayagan release postponed, Europe distributor announces Amid the censor delay row, Thalapathy Vijay's much-anticipated film Jana Nayagan has been postponed. The film was slated to release on January 9.

Cobra director backs Jana Nayagan amid censor delay row: Absolute misuse of power Cobra director Ajay R Gnanamuthu has expressed solidarity with Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan team following the film's release postponement. He highlighted the efforts of the film crew in an X post and commented on the broader impact of the delay.

Yash cancels 40th birthday fan meet, says Toxic is his priority Yash informed his fans there would be no birthday meet this year as he dedicates his attention to finishing the film Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-Ups. In a lengthy note on Instagram, the actor apologised and promised something bigger.

Hema Malini recalls unsettling early days in Mumbai, living in haunted house Hema Malini, famed for her work in Hindi cinema, shared a story from early days in Mumbai, including living in a haunted house.

Sonu Nigam performs Ghar Kab Aaoge for Mumbai Police ahead of Border 2 release Singer Sonu Nigam performed Ghar Kab Aaoge from the upcoming film Border 2 as a tribute to Mumbai Police. The film is set to release across theatres on January 23.

Anil Kapoor marks 43 years of his Kannada debut, lauds Yash and Rishab Shetty Veteran actor Anil Kapoor celebrates 43 years since his Kannada film debut Pallavi Anu Pallavi. He applauds the booming Kannada cinema industry and hints at future collaborations.

From end of fixed voices for stars to AI: Shruti Pathak talks Bollywood music trends Singer Shruti Pathak opened up the evolving music scene and the dying trend of fixed voices for actors. In an exclusive interview, she highlighted challenges like fading solo female songs and AI taking over creative spaces.

Shark Tank India 5: Aman takes swipe at Anupam, asks about his closed companies A recent episode of Shark Tank India Season 5 featured a tense argument between judges Aman Gupta and Anupam Mittal, sparked by a pitch from Mumbai entrepreneurs.

Yami Gautam in Haq draws Farah Khan's praise: Get ready to receive every award Yami Gautam continues to receive widespread praise for her performance in Haq, with Farah Khan lauding her work after watching the film on Netflix.

The Raja Saab: Prabhas film gets Andhra government clearance for ticket price hike Ticket prices for Prabhas' upcoming film The Raja Saab have been increased in Andhra Pradesh, with special premiere tickets set at Rs. 1000 and regular show prices raised for the first ten days after release.

Honeymoon Se Hatya OTT release: When and where to watch crime docuseries Honeymoon Se Hatya, a new docuseries directed by Ajitesh Sharma, will be available to stream on ZEE5. Directed by Ajitesh Sharma, it will be produced by Aditya Pittie and Samar Khan.

Sreeleela opens up about adopting two children at 21: It was a secret Sreeleela has spoken about adopting two children and explained why she does not consider herself to be a traditional mother. While her adopted children do not live with her, the actor said she keeps visiting them.

Tanya Mittal takes a dig at Bigg Boss 19 winner Gaurav Khanna during Dubai reunion Tanya Mittal reignites rivalry with Bigg Boss 19 winner Gaurav Khanna during Dubai reunion. She shares emotional struggles and reasons for avoiding interviews post-show.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan censor row: Madras High Court reserves order The Madras High Court has reserved its orders in the Jana Nayagan certification case after hearing arguments from the CBFC and producer KVN Studios over delays, complaints, and the film's U/A 16+ clearance.

Gwyneth Paltrow claims divorce from Coldplay's Chris Martin cost her a movie role Oscar-winning actor Gwyneth Paltrow has spoken openly about the impact her divorce from Chris Martin had on her career. She revealed on a recent podcast that she was dismissed from a film project due to the scrutiny surrounding her personal life.

Splitsvilla X6: All about new format, venue, rumoured contestants and more MTV Splitsvilla X6 returns with Sunny Leone and Karan Kundrra as hosts. The new season will witness a fresh format dividing 32 contestants into Pyaar (love) and Paisa (money) villas.
Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal reveal son's name, share first photo Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal have revealed the name of their son, Vihaan Kaushal. The baby boy was born on November 7, 2025.

Spring Fever review: Ahn Bo Hyun leads a charmingly chaotic K-dramaRelease Date:Tue Jul 01, 2025 Spring Fever is a warm rom-com that blends fantasy with heartfelt romance. The series' quirky charm and strong performances make it a must-watch on Prime Video.

Dhurandhar star Ranveer Singh thanks 'alma mater' YRF after they praise film Ranveer Singh's film Dhurandhar becomes the highest-grossing Indian film in a single language, receiving industry-wide acclaim and marking a significant milestone for the cast and crew.

general news.headline: US seizes Russian-flagged oil tanker linked to Venezuela after dramatic chaseUS officials had been tracking the tanker across the Atlantic after it evaded a US maritime blockade, refused repeated boarding requests by US Coast Guard personnel, and attempted to evade interdiction by changing flags and registration.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan release postponed, Europe distributor announcesAmid the censor delay row, Thalapathy Vijay's much-anticipated film Jana Nayagan has been postponed. The film was slated to release on January 9.

'Sir, may I see you please,' PM Modi said: Trump's latest in his India remarksUS President Donald Trump claimed that Narendra Modi personally approached him over long-pending Apache helicopter deliveries and trade issues, while acknowledging a strong personal rapport.

Bangladesh firm on T20 World Cup stance: No cricket at cost of national dignityBangladesh have remained firm on their decision not to play T20 World Cup matches in India, citing security and national humiliation concerns following Mustafizur Rahman's exit from Kolkata Knight Riders, which has escalated tensions with India.

Pak may or may not go to Gaza, but Hamas has come to PakVideos of Hamas leader Naji Zaher allegedly at a Lashkar-e-Taiba terror camp in Pakistan have emerged online. This confirms the growing ties between Hamas and Pakistani terrorist groups and comes even as Islamabad debates whether to send troops to Gaza.

Unacceptable: Fadnavis blasts local BJP leaders over Congress, AIMIM alliancesAs the stunning 'alliances' between the BJP and Congress and AIMIM caused political tremors, Fadnavis declared that such arrangements had not been approved by the party's top leadership.

Donald please...: Trump mocks Macron over tariffs, makes another shocking claimThe US President said that he coerced Macron to increase the price of prescription drugs by threatening him with US tarrifs on French imports.
Deliberately creating conditions for defaming JNU: Teacher's body slams admin, PoliceDeliberately creating conditions for defaming JNU: Teacher's body slams admin, Police for FIR against students

10 daughters and 19 years later, Haryana couple welcomes baby boyThe couple said they had long hoped for a son but never discriminated against their daughters. He said that he raised all his daughters just as he would raise a boy.

Cold wave to peak: North India to experience freezing conditions tomorrowNorth India faces a severe cold wave and dense fog, disrupting travel in Delhi and Punjab on January 8. Meanwhile, a depression in the Bay of Bengal brings heavy rain warnings for Tamil Nadu.

I fear Iran's next, it'll be hotter than Venezuela, economist Jeffrey Sachs warnsRenowned economist Jeffrey Sachs warns that Iran could be Trump's next target after Venezuela, calling the US a "rogue state" with no constitutional order. He reveals decades of regime change operations and predicts a potential global explosion if Trump follows through on threats against Tehran.

Dropped from Bangladesh Premier League? Indian sports presenter clarifies exitIndian sports presenter Ridhima Pathak has clarified her exit from the Bangladesh Premier League, affirming her decision was voluntary amid ongoing India-Bangladesh cricket tensions. Bangladesh banned the broadcast of the IPL 2026 in the country after Mustafizur Rahman's contract was terminated by the BCCI.

Lamp, Deepathoon and dargah: How Madurai's sacred hill became a mound of dispute?What began as a ritual dispute over Karthigai Deepam at Thiruparankundram escalated into a legal and political battle. The Madras High Court upheld hilltop lamp lighting, rejecting law-and-order fears, even as the state moved higher courts.

How an Aussie's underwear, jailhouse tip led to Kerala MLA's disqualificationKerala court convicted sitting MLA and former minister, Antony Raju, of tampering with evidence in a 1990 drug case, sentencing him to three years in prison and triggering his automatic disqualification from the Assembly.

Lalu's grandson joins Singapore military training programmeRJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's grandson Aditya, has begun Basic Military Training in Singapore. However, the 18-year-old is not joining the Singapore Armed Forces, and is fulfilling the country's mandatory National Service requirement, which involves two years of training to build discipline, endurance and leadership qualities.

After Op Sindoor, Pak spends $5 million on US lobbying to access Trump govt: ReportUS Foreign Agents Registration Act filings reveal Pakistan spent nearly $5 million on an aggressive lobbying campaign in Washington after India's Operation Sindoor to gain access to the Trump establishment and key US institutions.

Tata Harrier, Safari petrol launched, price starts at Rs 12.89 lakhTata Motors has launched the long-awaited petrol variants of the Harrier and Safari, introducing a new 1.5-litre turbo engine, advanced features, and 5-star safety at highly competitive starting prices.

Fake degree racket in Kerala sets off political firestorm in AustraliaThe busting of a fake degree racket in Kerala has ended up creating a political firestorm in Australia. Queensland Senator Malcom Roberts has used it to attack the Albanese government. Roberts said Australia was host to numerous Indian students with fraudulent degrees and blamed the Albanese for inaction.

Shashi Tharoor meets Kerala teen building AI in Indian languages on Vande BharatCongress MP Shashi Tharoor met 16-year-old tech innovator Raul John Aju on a Vande Bharat train, discussing the importance of AI that supports India's linguistic diversity.

How long will Delhi schools stay shut due to cold wave?Delhi schools will remain closed till January 15, 2026, as the capital continues to battle a severe cold wave, dense fog and poor air quality. The Directorate of Education extended winter holidays to protect students, as low temperatures and weather alerts disrupt daily life across the city.
Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal reveal son's name, share first photoKatrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal have revealed the name of their son, Vihaan Kaushal. The baby boy was born on November 7, 2025.

Shreyas Iyer declared fit by BCCI, cleared for New Zealand ODI seriesShreyas Iyer has been declared fit for international cricket after receiving clearance from the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Centre of Excellence (CoE), removing the final medical hurdle ahead of India's ODI series against New Zealand.
Global Nestlé baby formula recall: Why Indian parents must stay alertA global recall over a rare toxin has spared India for now, yet experts urge vigilance.

Bengaluru man works as Rapido bike captain for 4 days, shares earnings breakdownThe man shared a transparent breakdown of hours worked, earnings and expenses after riding part-time with Rapido, primarily during late-night hours.

sports.headline: How Jasprit Bumrah inspired Shreyanka Patil to bounce back after injury Indian all-rounder Shreyanka Patil credits Jasprit Bumrah's guidance during her injury-hit layoff for helping her regain confidence as she prepares for a WPL 2026 comeback with RCB against Mumbai Indians.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi's heroics with bat and ball leads India-U19 to 3-0 whitewash Vaibhav Suryavanshi led from the front with a century and a wicket as India U-19 crushed South Africa by 233 runs to seal a dominant 3-0 whitewash in the Youth ODI series.

Bangladesh firm on T20 World Cup stance: No cricket at cost of national dignity Bangladesh have remained firm on their decision not to play T20 World Cup matches in India, citing security and national humiliation concerns following Mustafizur Rahman's exit from Kolkata Knight Riders, which has escalated tensions with India.

Don't like India-Pakistan cricket beef: Ex-West Indies captain calls for unity Jason Holder says the India–Pakistan divide is sad and should not overshadow cricket. The West Indies all-rounder believes sport can play a role in easing political tensions.

England must now move on from failed Bazball project after Ashes: Vaughan England must finally move away from their high-risk 'Bazball' approach and return to Test cricket basics after their Ashes defeat, former captain Michael Vaughan said in an interview with Reuters on Wednesday.

Shreyas Iyer declared fit by BCCI, cleared for New Zealand ODI series Shreyas Iyer has been declared fit for international cricket after receiving clearance from the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Centre of Excellence (CoE), removing the final medical hurdle ahead of India's ODI series against New Zealand.

New Zealand worried about ODI series vs India, not T20 World Cup: Daryl Mitchell New Zealand are not dwelling on the T20 World Cup, which is still a month away, and are instead focused on the immediate challenge of taking on India's bowlers in the upcoming white-ball series, batter Daryl Mitchell said on Wednesday.

Harmanpreet Kaur credits WPL, Mumbai Indians for bringing that winning mindset in her Ahead of the Women's Premier League season in Mumbai, players and coaches highlight the transformative impact of the franchise and the WPL on Indian women's cricket, linking domestic professionalism to international triumphs.

Solskjaer, Carrick frontrunners for caretaker role at Manchester United: Report Manchester United are weighing up a short-term return to familiar faces, with Ole Gunnar Solskjær and Michael Carrick emerging as the leading contenders to take over as caretaker manager until the end of the season, according to reports.

Yo Yo Honey Singh, Jacqueline Fernandez set to perform in WPL 2026 opening ceremony Yo Yo Honey Singh and Jacqueline Fernandez will headline the WPL 2026 opening ceremony in Navi Mumbai, adding star power and high-energy entertainment ahead of the RCB vs MI season opener on Friday, January 9.

Gujarat Giants bank on Renuka Singh boost to change fortunesWPL 2026: Fast bowler Renuka Singh, who played the first three seasons for the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB), is now set to represent the Gujarat Titans in the Women's Premier League.

Kobbie Mainoo returns to training for Manchester United after Ruben Amorim's sackingKobbie Mainoo returned to training as Manchester United prepares for life after Ruben Amorim. The midfielder could feature against Burnley as Darren Fletcher takes interim charge.

Virat Kohli mobbed by fans on arrival at Vadodara ahead of New Zealand ODIs: WatchVirat Kohli received a rousing welcome in Vadodara ahead of India's ODI series against New Zealand. The batting great arrives in red-hot form for his first international outing of 2026.

New Year, same hunger: Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashes 63-ball hundred in South AfricaIndia vs South Africa, 3rd Youth ODI: Vaibhav Suryavanshi hit a 63-ball hundred, bringing up his first three-figure score on South African soil. The 14-year-old was leading India U19 against South Africa on Wednesday.

Pakistan hopeful of pacer Shaheen Afridi's recovery ahead of T20 World CupPakistan's T20 captain Salman Ali Agha has expressed optimism over Shaheen Shah Afridi's recovery from a knee injury, saying the premier pacer is on track to regain full fitness in time for next month's T20 World Cup.

PV Sindhu, Satwik-Chirag make winning starts to 2026 seasonMalaysia Open 2026: PV Sindhu made a winning return to the circuit, beating Chinese Taipei's Sung Shuo Yun in straight games. While third seeds Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty eased into the second round in men's doubles, Gayatri Gopichand and Treesa Jolly were knocked out in women's doubles first round on Wednesday.

Mohan Baigan, East Baigan: Sports Minister flubs iconic club namesIndia's Sports Minister mispronouncing Mohun Bagan and East Bengal during an ISL press conference sparked instant backlash. The slip-up overshadowed the league's restart announcement and reopened questions around football awareness at the top.

India Open: Lakshya vs Ayush in 1st round as Indian shuttlers handed brutal drawLakshya Sen opens his title defence against fellow Indian Ayush Shetty in the first round of the India Open 2026, as Indian shuttlers face a demanding draw on home turf.

India's Asian Games medallist chooses Canada. Why shooter Angad Bajwa made the switchAsian Games hopeful Angad Vir Singh Bajwa has ended his Indian chapter by switching nationality to Canada. Backed by formal NRAI clearance, the move reflects personal roots abroad and a carefully weighed career decision.

SCG Test: Bethell's heroic century delays the inevitable for England on Day 4Jacob Bethell stood between England and defeat for most of Day 4 at the Sydney Cricket Ground, producing a composed maiden Test century in an innings otherwise marked by familiar collapses. The 22-year-old walked off unbeaten on 142 at stumps as England closed on 302 for eight, holding a modest lead of 119 runs.

Tears in the stands as Jacob Bethell hits maiden Test hundred in SydneyAshes 2025-26: Jacob Bethell's father was moved to tears after his 22-year-old son hit his maiden Test hundred in Sydney on Wednesday. Bethell remained unbeaten on 142 as England went to Stumps on Day 4 of the fifth Test with a 119-run lead and two wickets in hand.

Jemimah Rodrigues faces stern test of acing huge Delhi Capitals captaincy challengeWPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues will lead Delhi Capitals for the first time, but she has prior experience of captaining at the domestic level. The youngster has a big task ahead, replacing the legendary Meg Lanning at the Delhi Capitals.

Neymar lives Batman dream with million-dollar Batmobile, Batcopter and jet flexNeymar has fulfilled a childhood dream by adding a Batmobile to his collection. Parked beside his Batcopter and private jet, the purchase underlines the Brazilian star's flair for the extraordinary off the pitch.

Bangladesh deny claims of ICC ultimatum over not playing T20 World Cup in IndiaThe Bangladesh Cricket Board on Wednesday firmly rejected media reports suggesting it had received an ultimatum from the International Cricket Council regarding Bangladesh's participation in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, set to be hosted in India.

Dropped from Bangladesh Premier League? Indian sports presenter clarifies exitIndian sports presenter Ridhima Pathak has clarified her exit from the Bangladesh Premier League, affirming her decision was voluntary amid ongoing India-Bangladesh cricket tensions. Bangladesh banned the broadcast of the IPL 2026 in the country after Mustafizur Rahman's contract was terminated by the BCCI.

Are clubs paying to play ISL? How AIFF is making Indian football cryISL's return masks deeper trouble as clubs are forced to fund the league themselves. Pay cuts, player exits and rushed decisions show Indian football's problems did not end with confirming the 2025–26 season.

Message to Anushka? Fans spot Virat Kohli's special cardigan at Mumbai airportVirat Kohli made a notable arrival at Mumbai airport on Tuesday evening, wearing a distinctive cardigan that sparked discussion among fans. Kohli will join the Indian ODI squad in Vadodara, which will host the ODI series opener against New Zealand on January 11.

Was India's historic 2018-19 Test series win in Australia overrated?January 7 marks the 7th anniversary of India's historic Test series win in Australia. Today we revisit India's landmark 2018–19 series, and the debate – whether it was overrated?

Ashes: Ben Stokes injured in Sydney as England's tour goes from bad to worseEngland's Ashes misery deepened in Sydney after Ben Stokes limped off injured on Day 4. The captain's groin problem added to England's growing list of concerns in a tour slipping further away.

With LA 28 qualification in sight, can India move on from Manpreet Singh?As India chase Asian Games gold and LA Olympics qualification, Manpreet Singh's fitness, experience and versatility remain irreplaceable. But with his future now under cloud, can Indian hockey afford to move on from their veteran dynamic midfielder?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
